__TOC__


Here we have a sampling of bugs to work on for Hug Day.  After you have triaged or fixed a bug put your name in the last column and set the row background to a green color by adding '''lightgreen''' in the first cell of the column after "background-color:" and before ";".  This will let people know that the bug in that row has been worked on.

=== 475 bugs without a package ===

These bugs have been reported about Ubuntu in general but do not have a software package associated with them, subsequently they are unlikely to be looked at by a developer.  We can help easily help these bug reports through the process by assigning a package to them.  Even better would be to follow up with the reporter if necessary.  More of these bugs can be found with <nowiki>[[http://tinyurl.com/22gw9k|this]]</nowiki> bug query.

Help regarding which package to choose can be found at <nowiki>[[Bugs/FindRightPackage]]</nowiki> and a list of wiki pages regarding how to debug specific packages and subsystems can be found at DebuggingProcedures .

'''To mark it off the list you should:'''
* At a minimum assign the bug to a package so it has a better change of getting attention '''or'''
* Assign a package '''and''' ask a question and set the bug's status to Incomplete '''or'''
* If the bug is not a bug but a support request direct the reporter to the support tracker '''or'''
* If it is a bug about something needing to be packaged - tag the bug as 'needs-packaging' prepend '[needs-packaging]' to the summary and set the status to Confirmed and importance to Wishlist
